title: SOLD--McGraw added--Starter's Set--50 P-F, w. 4 h-o-f + Chase--$777--
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: SOLD--McGraw added--Starter's Set--50 P-F, w. 4 h-o-f + Chase--$777--
posts.post_content:
PENDING COMPLETION OF SALE--These are all ungraded, divided into pages by condition.  They range from Poor to Fair, with a good-sized discount for all 49. 
 
In the event they don't sell as a group by Saturday, 2/6/15, I'll sell them individually.  You can reserve cards starting now [first to reserve a card gets it].  I've given general price ranges for all cards, and if you want an individual card/cards, let me know and I'll give you a price. 
Discounts for multiple items and combined shipping. 

Email: [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url] [No pm's, please; my PM Box is often full].
Payment: Ppff djdoremus@msn. com [no messages, please]; thanks.
Regular paypal, add 3%.  Checks are okay, too. 

Group of four:

McGinnity, Poor,
Chase, blue portrait [upon scrutiny I suspect a pushed-in pinhole botton-left corner, doesn't show in scan],
Marquard, beater,
Kelley, beater.

Page 1--A page of 15 Poors.  Individually, these cards will be $13-17, delivered.

Quinn,
Maddux,
Williams, StL,
Kling,
McLean,
La Porte,
Moriarty, 
Wiltse, 
Schmidt [Note: these last three all have VG-Ex fronts, bad backs],
Schreck,
Donlin,
Dygert,
Krause portrait,
Doolan [has a spot of paper-loss on the front; it's not obvious, being on his uniform],
Egan.

Page 2--A page of 15 P-F--Individually, these cards will be $15-19 delivered--

Davis, Philadelphia,
Rhoades throwing,
Knight batting,
Krause in wind-up,
Sullivan,
Snodgrass batting,
Jones, Detroit,
Byrne,
Bowerman,
Dougherty portrait,
Hall [note punch-hole below Baltimore],
Dunn, Baltimore,
Stovall portrait,
Myers catching,
Shaw, Providence.

Page 3--A page of 15 Fairs. Individually, these cards will be $16-21 delivered--

Covaleski,
Burns,
Beck fielding,
Hemphill,
Wright,
Elberfeld fielding,
Devlin,
Schlafy [cracked out of a PSA 2 holder!],
Hoffman,
Smith, Buffalo,
Phillippe,
Seymour pitching,
White, Chi, pitching
Myers batting,
O'Leary, hands on knees.

*Note on Scans: As the page is turned, the backs are in reverse order. 
Also, the cards are in two protective plastics, a halved penny-sleeve--which creates the appearance of a vertical line on each card--and a pocket-page:

What happened to this McGraw--Is it wear?--That's what it looks like, but wear is not consistent with the rest of the card.  
Perhaps it was in an album and the front stuck a little to the page in front--That's my guess.
